oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Marty Robbins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Marty Robbins (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marty Robbins; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) El Paso [featuring Marty Robbins and Rick Phillips voiceover] (Marty Robbins) -- (00:45) El Paso [featuring Marty Robbins and Rick Phillips voiceover] (Marty Robbins) -- (01:28) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (02:03) U.S. Customs commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (02:58) Devil Woman (Marty Robbins) -- (04:32) Rick Phillips introduces Marty Robbins, and both discuss Robbins' racing career -- (06:43) Ribbon of Darkness (Marty Robbins) -- (08:59) Rick Phillips radio spot for the Fort Lee meal card tests -- (09:43) Singing the Blues (Marty Robbins) -- (10:45) Phillips inquires as to what inspired "Singing the Blues;" additionally, Robbins' association to the Grand Ole Opry is discussed -- (13:17) I Walk Alone (Marty Robbins) -- (15:10) Phillips radio spot for the Minnesota National Guard recruiting jobs -- (15:43) Don't Worry (Marty Robbins) -- (18:41) Phillips introduces "Don't Worry" and Robbins associates it to a memory from the Grand Ole Opry -- (20:49) Phillips and Robbins reflect on the change of Robbins' career when songs like "White Sport Coat" hit the charts -- (21:27) White Sport Coat (Marty Robbins) -- (23:52) Safety radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (24:21) Story of My Life (Marty Robbins) -- (26:47) Lonesome Blues [featuring Retention radio spot hosted by Faron Young] (Faron Young) -- (29:19) Big Iron (Marty Robbins) -- (33:08) Feron Young reflects on his time in the military -- (34:22) My Woman, My Woman, My Wife (Marty Robbins) -- (37:42) Robbins reflect on his heart attack when recalling "My Woman, My Woman, My Wife" -- (39:33) Love Me (Marty Robbins) -- (42:07) United States Environmental Protection Agency commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (43:06) Tonight Carman (Marty Robbins) -- (45:49) Phillips asks Robbins how he became the host of Midnight Special; additionally, the timing of "El Paso" is discussed -- (49:45) El Paso (Marty Robbins) -- (53:57) Phillips praises Robbins and performs an Exchange Travel Information commercial spot -- (54:55) Hallmarks outro tune ([Unidentified]) -- (56:29) Phillips introduces guest disc jockey: Mark Edwards -- (57:41) Phillips and Edwards discuss the instrumentation George Jones had started performing; additionally, Phillips inquires about the acceptance of country music in Chicago -- (59:31) The hype behind Don Drum is reflected on, and Edwards declares that "Who Am I," by Charley Pride, is the focus of the week -- (1:01:05) Phillips and Edwards say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Robbins, Marty; Phillips, Rick;
